raw_json.html_title: Example 7.17: The Smith College diploma problem | R-bloggers
raw_json.main_html:
Example 7.17: The Smith College diploma problem

Posted on November 12, 2009 by Nick Horton in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on SAS and R, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

Smith College is a residential women’s liberal arts college in Northampton, MA that is steeped in tradition. One such tradition is to give each student at graduation a diploma at random (or more accurately, in a haphazard fashion). At the end of the ceremony, a diploma circle is formed, and students pass the diplomas that they receive to the person next to them, and step out once they’ve
